meanings.definition: Side to side; across the width of a ship.
meanings.sent1: The sailor moved athwartships to reach the other side of the ship quickly.
meanings.sent2: The cargo shifted athwartships during the storm, causing the ship to list.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous seagull flew athwartships, trying to avoid the captain's gaze.
meanings.sent4: The waves crashed athwartships, rocking the vessel violently.
meanings.sent5: The plank extended athwartships, creating a makeshift bridge between the decks.

meanings.definition: In a direction perpendicular to the ship's length.
meanings.sent1: The crew adjusted the sails athwartships to catch the crosswind.
meanings.sent2: The anchor was dropped athwartships to stabilize the ship in the strong current.
meanings.sent3: The curious dolphin swam athwartships, exploring the unfamiliar waters.
meanings.sent4: The seagulls hovered athwartships, waiting for any scraps from the deck.
meanings.sent5: The flag fluttered athwartships, signaling a change in course to the nearby vessels.

meanings.definition: Positioned or moving sideways on a ship.
meanings.sent1: The athwartships movement of the cargo caused a delay in unloading.
meanings.sent2: The athwartships position of the lifeboat made it easily accessible in emergencies.
meanings.sent3: The athwartships orientation of the hammock made it challenging to sleep comfortably.
meanings.sent4: The athwartships drift of the debris indicated a recent shipwreck in the area.
meanings.sent5: The athwartships view from the deck provided a unique perspective of the coastline.
